meanings.definition: The act of installing something again.
meanings.sent1: After the storm, the reinstallation of the roof was necessary.
meanings.sent2: I had to request a reinstallation of the internet service in my house.
meanings.sent3: The reinstallation of the fallen painting made the room look complete again.
meanings.sent4: The reinstallation of trust in their relationship took time after the betrayal.
meanings.sent5: The reinstallation of the old clock brought back memories of childhood.

meanings.definition: The process of setting up a software or program on a computer again.
meanings.sent1: The reinstallation of the antivirus software fixed the computer's issues.
meanings.sent2: When the system crashed, the reinstallation of all programs was necessary.
meanings.sent3: The reinstallation of the game caused excitement as new features were added.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a computer undergoing reinstallation, slowly processing each thought.
meanings.sent5: The reinstallation of the operating system made the laptop run faster.
